meanings.definition: One who encloses or surrounds something.
meanings.sent1: The incloser built a fence around the garden.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was the incloser of the animals in the barn.
meanings.sent3: The little incloser made sure all the toys were neatly put away.
meanings.sent4: The incloser of secrets locked them away in a hidden box.
meanings.sent5: The protective incloser shielded the fragile object from harm.

meanings.definition: A barrier or fence that encloses an area.
meanings.sent1: The wooden incloser kept the chickens safe from predators.
meanings.sent2: The garden was surrounded by a tall incloser to keep out pests.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb over the incloser but failed.
meanings.sent4: The ancient stone incloser stood strong against the test of time.
meanings.sent5: The electric incloser buzzed softly, marking the boundary of the property.

meanings.sent1: She decided to incloser her precious memories in a scrapbook.
meanings.sent2: The builder will incloser the construction site with a fence.
meanings.sent3: The magician used his wand to incloser the audience in a magical bubble.
meanings.sent4: The fog inclosered the town, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The warm embrace of friendship inclosered her heart with joy.
